thread.title: Giants wide receiver Rueben Randle does salsa for Victor Cruz after touchdown
thread.title_full: Giants wide receiver Rueben Randle does salsa for Victor Cruz after touchdown

author: Jordan Raanan | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Giants wide receiver Rueben Randle does salsa for Victor Cruz after touchdown
text:
Comments 
ORCHARD PARK, N.Y. ‐ The salsa is alive, even if Giants wide receiver Victor Cruz isn't the one doing the dancing. 
Cruz may not be with his teammates at Ralph Wilson Stadium to face the Buffalo Bills, but he's not forgotten. Wide receiver Ruben Randle did a little tribute to his injured teammate after am 11-yard second-quarter touchdown. 
This right here is the salsa, Cruz's patented touchdown celebration. Rueben Randle with a tribute to Victor Cruz #Salsa https://t.co/IsOHCDkZ6y — Giants Daily (@NYGDaily) October 4, 2015 
It's a touching tribute considering Cruz was supposed to return and play this week for the first since tearing the patellar tendon in his right knee last year. But Cruz has been struggling with a calf injury, and suffered another setback on Wednesday during his first practice in six weeks. He had a platelet-rich plasma (PRP) injection on Thursday.
